com.useful.uCarsAPI

Class uCarsAPI

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.useful.uCarsAPI.uCarsAPI

  • public class uCarsAPI
extends java.lang.Object
    Some basic API tools that allow plugins to manipulate uCars for their use
    Author:
    storm345

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.Boolean adduCarsMeta(org.bukkit.plugin.Plugin plugin, java.util.UUID entityId, java.lang.String statName, com.useful.ucarsCommon.StatValue toAdd)
      Sets uCarMeta for a car -uCarMeta is removed each time the server restarts so use for temporary buffs such as speed-buffs or upgrades (If you track and save them)
      java.lang.Boolean checkIfCar(org.bukkit.entity.Minecart car)

      java.lang.Boolean clearCarMeta(org.bukkit.plugin.Plugin plugin, java.util.UUID entityId)
      Clears uCarMeta for a car -uCarMeta is removed each time the server restarts so use for temporary buffs such as speed-buffs or upgrades (If you track and save them)

      Get the running instance of the API implementation

      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,com.useful.ucarsCommon.StatValue> getuCarMeta(java.util.UUID entityId)
      Gets all non-permanent uCarMeta for a car -uCarMeta is removed each time the server restarts so use for temporary buffs such as speed-buffs or upgrades (If you track and save them)

      Will hook your plugin into uCars.

      Registers an car speed mod check for your plugin, only one speed mod is allowed per hooked plugin.

      Remove a meta value of a car -uCarMeta is removed each time the server restarts so use for temporary buffs such as speed-buffs or upgrades (If you track and save them)

      • hookPlugin

        public void hookPlugin(org.bukkit.plugin.Plugin plugin)
        Will hook your plugin into uCars. This first step must be done before any API calls can be made.
        Parameters:
        plugin - Your plugin

      • unHookPlugin

        public void unHookPlugin(org.bukkit.plugin.Plugin plugin)
        Call onDisable() to show the user your plugin being unhooked. Else it will be unhooked automatically anyway.
        Parameters:
        plugin - Your plugin

      • unHookPlugins

        public void unHookPlugins()
        Will reset all hooked plugins -Don't call unless absolutely needed

      • isPluginHooked

        public java.lang.Boolean isPluginHooked(org.bukkit.plugin.Plugin plugin)
        Checks if your plugin is hooked, your plugin needs to be hooked to use the API
        Parameters:
        plugin - Your plugin
        Returns:
        True if the plugin is hooked, False if not

      • registerCarCheck

        public java.lang.Boolean registerCarCheck(org.bukkit.plugin.Plugin plugin,
                                 CarCheck carCheck)
        Registers an isACar() check for your plugin, only one check is allowed per hooked plugin. Trying to add more than one check will result in overriding the original
        Parameters:
        plugin - Your plugin
        carCheck - The CarCheck to perform
        Returns:
        True if registered, False if not because plugin isn't hooked

      • unRegisterCarCheck

        public java.lang.Boolean unRegisterCarCheck(org.bukkit.plugin.Plugin plugin)
        Removes a carCheck registered by a plugin
        Parameters:
        plugin - Your plugin
        Returns:
        True if unregistered, False if not because plugin isn't hooked

      • registerSpeedMod

        public java.lang.Boolean registerSpeedMod(org.bukkit.plugin.Plugin plugin,
                                 CarSpeedModifier speedMod)
        Registers an car speed mod check for your plugin, only one speed mod is allowed per hooked plugin. Trying to add more than one check will result in overriding the original
        Parameters:
        plugin - Your plugin
        speedMod - The speedMod to add
        Returns:
        True if registered, False if not because plugin isn't hooked

      • unRegisterSpeedMod

        Parameters:
        plugin - Your plugin
        Returns:

      • getuCarMeta

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,com.useful.ucarsCommon.StatValue> getuCarMeta(java.util.UUID entityId)
        Gets all non-permanent uCarMeta for a car -uCarMeta is removed each time the server restarts so use for temporary buffs such as speed-buffs or upgrades (If you track and save them)
        Parameters:
        entityId - Id of the uCar entity (ID can be changed without your notice So don't use this for tracking cars)
        Returns:
        All the meta set for that car

      • adduCarsMeta

        public java.lang.Boolean adduCarsMeta(org.bukkit.plugin.Plugin plugin,
                             java.util.UUID entityId,
                             java.lang.String statName,
                             com.useful.ucarsCommon.StatValue toAdd)
        Sets uCarMeta for a car -uCarMeta is removed each time the server restarts so use for temporary buffs such as speed-buffs or upgrades (If you track and save them)
        Parameters:
        plugin - Your plugin
        entityId - Id of the uCar entity (ID can be changed without your notice So don't use this for tracking cars)
        toAdd - The ucarMeta to add to the car
        statName - The key/Name of the stat eg. 'myPlugin.myStat'
        Returns:
        True is successful and False if plugin is not hooked or unsuccessful

      • getUcarMeta

        public com.useful.ucarsCommon.StatValue getUcarMeta(org.bukkit.plugin.Plugin plugin,
                                           java.lang.String statName,
                                           java.util.UUID entityId)
        Gets uCarMeta for a car -uCarMeta is removed each time the server restarts so use for temporary buffs such as speed-buffs or upgrades (If you track and save them)
        Parameters:
        plugin - Your plugin
        entityId - Id of the uCar entity (ID can be changed without your notice So don't use this for tracking cars)
        statName - The key/Name of the stat eg. 'myPlugin.myStat'
        Returns:
        ucarMeta is successful and null if not existing on car or plugin is not hooked or unsuccessful

      • removeUcarMeta

        public java.lang.Boolean removeUcarMeta(org.bukkit.plugin.Plugin plugin,
                               java.lang.String statName,
                               java.util.UUID entityId)
        Remove a meta value of a car -uCarMeta is removed each time the server restarts so use for temporary buffs such as speed-buffs or upgrades (If you track and save them)
        Parameters:
        plugin - Your plugin
        statName - The name of the stat to remove
        entityId - The entityId of the car
        Returns:
        True if removed, False if plugin not hooked or removal unsuccessful (Not set)

      • clearCarMeta

        public java.lang.Boolean clearCarMeta(org.bukkit.plugin.Plugin plugin,
                             java.util.UUID entityId)
        Clears uCarMeta for a car -uCarMeta is removed each time the server restarts so use for temporary buffs such as speed-buffs or upgrades (If you track and save them)
        Parameters:
        plugin - Your plugin
        entityId - Id of the uCar entity (ID can be changed without your notice So don't use this for tracking cars)
        Returns:
        True is successful and False is plugin is not hooked or unsuccessfull

      • updateUcarMeta

        public void updateUcarMeta(java.util.UUID previousId,
                  java.util.UUID newId)
        Updates the ID of a car entity
        Parameters:
        previousId - The old ID of the entity
        newId - The new ID of the entity

        Returns:
